etymology.description: 囗(“sheet”) + 大(“person”) = man on a mattress -> original form of 裀(yīn, “mat”) or 茵(yīn, “mattress”) -> borrowed for 'cause'
etymology.interpretation: The character 因(yīn, “cause”) combines the elements of a person 大(dà, “person”) inside a boundary 囗(wéi, “sheet”), suggesting a person lying on a surface such as a mattress or mat. This formation was originally used to describe a mat or cushion, but was phonetically borrowed to represent 'cause' in modern usage.

examples.chinese: 他因刻苦学习而取得优异成绩(他因刻苦學習而取得優異成績)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīn kèkǔ xuéxí ér qǔdé yōuyì chéngjì.
examples.english: He achieved excellent grades because of his diligent study.

examples.chinese: 他因家中有事(他因家中有事)，无法出席会议(無法出席會議)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīn jiāzhōng yǒushì, wúfǎ chūxí huìyì.
examples.english: He couldn’t attend the meeting because he had something going on at home.

examples.chinese: 因程序设计错误(因程式設計錯誤)，项目延期发布(項目延期發佈)。
examples.pinyin: Yīn chéngxù shèjì cuòwù, xiàngmù yánqī fābù.
examples.english: Due to programming design errors, the project release was delayed.
